item.title: eduroam wifi and google forms with an ESP32
item.description: I was excited by our initial success at a low-cost carbon dioxide monitor, so much so that I was immediately thinking about how to scale things up, and how to get more data and in a less cumbersome way. Our initial build just has a CO2 sensor, a simple Arduino microcontroller, and an LCD display. It shows the current CO2 concentration plus the maximum and average since it was last turned on.
